Product Title: A Royal Christmas

Store: Lacey Chabert  (Actor),     Stephen Hagan  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas
Product Description: ['Leo and Emily have been dating for quite some time when he proposes, and during his proposal, he confesses that he is actually Prince Leopold, Duke of Winterstone, and heir to the throne of a sovereign state bordering Switzerland. Leo s mother (Isadora, the Queen) finds out that he has proposed to an American commoner (without her blessing) and becomes outraged. In a series of events, she sabotages their courtship and does everything in her power to drive the couple apart. But will she succeed?']
Average Rating: 4.8

A Princess for Christmas
McGrath, Katie  (Actor),     Moore, Roger  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas
['Product Description', 'At the invitation of an estranged relative, a young woman travels with her niece and nephew to a castle in Europe for Christmas, where she unwittingly falls for a dashing Prince.', 'Amazon.com', "Raising two children on your own isn't easy, but Jules Daly is discovering that being the sole guardian of her deceased sister and brother-in-law's children is doubly difficult. As if dealing with the kids' first Christmas without their parents isn't hard enough, Jules loses her job, the nanny quits, her teenage nephew Milo steals a video game, and Milo and his 7-year-old sister Maddie are constantly bickering. A knock on the door brings an offer of a holiday abroad at Castlebury Hall, the mansion owned by the children's grandfather Duke Huntington. Jules hesitates because the Duke previously wanted nothing to do with her sister or his grandchildren, but eventually decides the threesome has little to lose. When they arrive, the Duke is not exactly bursting with goodwill and holiday spirit, and Jules's outspokenness combined with the children's wild ways threaten to make a bad situation even worse. But surprisingly, disrupting everyone's routines proves a powerful catalyst for positive change. The opulent mansion and breathtaking countryside provide a beautiful setting for the film, and Katie McGrath, Sam Heughan, and Roger Moore portray their characters well. While the family's difficult situation is fairly believable, the resolutions come far too easily. Nonetheless, the sentiment that the bonds of love and family can overcome even the strongest adversity resonates at any time of the year. (Ages 7 and older)", '--Tami Horiuchi']

Payback
Mel Gibson  (Actor),     Mark Alfa  (Actor),     Steve Gerbson  (Director),     Mic Rodgers  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Drama
['Porter (Mel Gibson) is a thief betrayed by both his wife, Lynn (Deborah Kara Unger), and his partner, Val (Gregg Henry), when he is shot in the back after a heist. Slowly, Porter recovers from his wounds and begins a search for Val, intent on recovering his share of the money they stole together. With the aid of prostitute Rosie (Maria Bello), Porter captures Val but still cannot find his cash. For this, Porter will have to challenge an imposing crime syndicate called the Outfit.']

A Boyfriend for Christmas [DVD]
Kelli Williams  (Actor),     Patrick Muldoon  (Actor),     Kevin Connor  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
['DVD: 05-51361 A Boyfriend for Christmas Kelli Williams (The Practice) is Holly Grant, an idealistic lawyer who gave up on finding Mr. Right in her stocking when she split with her last boyfriend. OSCAR nominee Charles Durning (To Be or Not to Be) plays Santa, who fulfills an old promise by bringing her and another attorney, Ryan Hughes (Patrick Muldoon), together. Due to an earlier misunderstanding, Ryan doesn\x92t want Holly to know who he is, so when Santa sends him to deliver a Christmas tree, he introduces himself as "Douglas Firewood." His well-meaning white lie threatens to derail a budding romance, and spoil Santa\x92s plan, in this warm-hearted holiday treat. Running Time: Approx. 100 Minutes Color/NTSC/Stereo']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user continues to favor emotionally resonant narratives, particularly in family and kids genres, with a notable recent focus on festive content. Their enjoyment of heartwarming holiday themes is reinforced by a renewed interest in cheerful and lighthearted storytelling.

- **Rating Tendencies:** Maintaining an impressive average rating of 4.6, the user's latest review of a Christmas movie reflected a strong appreciation for uplifting films that balance humor and sentimentality, showcasing their inclination towards accessible narratives.

- **Language & Accessibility:** The user prefers English audio with subtitles, ensuring a rich and engaging viewing experience while favoring accessible formats.

- **Director & Producer Influence:** They are drawn to creators who deliver dynamic storytelling, particularly those who provide joyful escapism integrated with emotional depth, reflecting their diverse entertainment tastes.

- **Actor Preference:** The user favors impactful performances from actors who convey warmth and authenticity, focusing on those involved in family-oriented films.

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user expresses ongoing satisfaction with their movie choices, highlighting a consistent inclination towards narratives that evoke positive emotions. Their recent embrace of festive comedies illustrates a balanced taste that values both emotional engagement and joyful experiences throughout the year.
